image.altText: Sexyland Exterior

props.synopsis: Workers at adult store chain Sexyland say they are harassed and threatened by customers on an almost nightly basis, with the stores lacking reporting systems to monitor abuse.

title.children: Sexyland workers allege 'disgusting and traumatic' harassment and sales

image.altText: South Australian One Nation state MP Sarah Game.

props.synopsis: South Australian One Nation MP Sarah Game says she is quitting the party and will serve out the remainder of her term as an independent, becoming the second SA upper house member to quit her party in the past week.

title.children: Sarah Game quits Pauline Hanson's One Nation to stand as independent

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old man was last week arrested and accused of threatening violent attacks on an SA school and public events, following what the premier described as the "probably the most complex and significant case" he had been briefed on. Here's a look at what we know.

title.children: What we know about alleged violent threats on SA school and events

image.altText: Chelsey Potter is wearing a white collared shirt and smiling

props.synopsis: Once a prospective SA Liberal candidate, Chelsey Potter says she feels disillusioned and "politically homeless" - and she's not alone.

title.children: Former SA Liberal staffer says she couldn't vote for Dutton-led party

image.altText: Nevill Westwood stands aside Bubsie, wearing overalls and a hat. The image is black and white.

props.synopsis: A 102-year-old restored Citroën will retrace the first circumnavigation of Australia exactly a century after the feat was achieved by the same model.

title.children: Century-old car brought back to life to retrace 1925 circumnavigation

image.altText: Tammy Franks in front of microphones with her arms out

props.synopsis: The now-former South Australian's Greens co-leader Tammy Franks quit the party this week and didn't go quietly. But what happens now for the party?

title.children: 'It's not easy being green': Kermit's famous line resonates for Greens

image.altText: Man in cap with sunglasses and a white moustache and blue checkered shirt with dark trousers stands in outback station

props.synopsis: Pastoralists in the far west of NSW are trialling new ways to manage arid landscapes by re-introducing native seeds to make the environment more rain-ready.

title.children: Farmers 'already pleased' with arid land rehabilitated with native seeds

image.altText: A woman with black hair stands by the Murray River holding a diary that was returned to her

props.synopsis: A diary dating back to pre-World War I that was left on the doorstep of an RSL club in Adelaide has been united with the descendants of its writer.

title.children: Mysterious 121yo diary returned to its roots

image.altText: JJ cries and gestures toward a camera as votes came in for Austria at Eurovision

props.synopsis: Austria wins Eurovision for 2025, overtaking Israel in a tense vote to claim the crown after a stunning performance from singer JJ.

title.children: Austria wins Eurovision, overtaking Israel in tense grand final vote

image.altText: Pope holds Mass during formal inauguration.

props.synopsis: The mass in St Peter's Square marks the start of the pontificate of the first American to lead the Roman Catholic Church.

title.children: Pope Leo condemns exploitation of the poor at inaugural mass

image.altText: A photo of a young couple smiling at the camera while sitting in the backseat of a car

props.synopsis: Former Olympian cyclist Melissa Hoskins died after being struck by a car driven by her husband outside their Adelaide home. This is how the case against Rohan Dennis unfolded.

title.children: How an argument ended with the 'unfair and tragic' death of a champion cyclist

image.altText: de-identified photos of a blonde woman in her late 30s

props.synopsis: The Queensland government says it's considering amendments to IVF legislation after some patients were told they would be unable to proceed with treatment under new laws.

title.children: IVF patient whose embryo doesn’t comply with new donor laws gets go ahead for treatment

image.altText: A young woman with a buzz cut and nose ring smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: One young Australian says she's developed an "emotional bond" with an AI chatbot after using it for mental health support.

title.children: 'I've actually formed an emotional bond with it': Young Australians using AI bots for therapy

image.altText: Actor Samuel Johnson.

props.synopsis: He's won a Gold Logie and raised $20m for cancer, but actor Samuel Johnson says his story is no "bullshit redemptive narrative".

title.children: Actor Samuel Johnson felt like a 'turd burger' — until he woke from a coma

image.altText: Pedestrians shelter from rain under umbrellas in a wet city.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain will drench Australia's east coast next week, but there will be no relief for drought-ravaged South Australia, Victoria and south-west New South Wales.

title.children: First taste of winter with upcoming temperature drop after warm autumn

image.altText: a man in a blue formal shirt sitting at a park bench with a body of water behind him

props.synopsis: Riverland resident Mike Fuller is pleased to see government agencies have admitted some faults, particularly in sourcing local knowledge, when managing major River Murray flooding.

title.children: Flooded residents welcome call to be included should another disaster strike

image.altText: A firefighter using a firehose on a smouldering fire inside a burnt out remnant of a warehouse.

props.synopsis: Ukraine's deputy prime minister accuses Russia of targeting civilians in strikes on a number of cities across the country.

title.children: Ukraine accuses Russia of targeting civilians in 'record' drone attack

image.altText: A packed crowd of Gazans hold out bowls and containers as a man issues soup from a large pot.

props.synopsis: Israel's prime minister says his country will introduce a "basic amount of food" to the population of Gaza, in what appears to be a lifting of the total aid blockade in the war-ravaged strip.

title.children: Israel will allow a 'basic amount' of food aid into Gaza

image.altText: Brady Hough is hugged by teammates in celebration

props.synopsis: West Coast pays an emotional tribute to Adam Selwood before its game against St Kilda and then registers its first win of the 2025 season, and the first of senior coach Andrew McQualter's tenure.

title.children: 'Today was more than just footy': Eagles respond to Selwood tragedy with stirring win

image.altText: Lando Norris talks to Oscar Piastri

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen overtook Oscar Piastri on the first lap of the Emilia-Romagna Grand Prix and streaked away to win the race, with the Australian left frustrated with third place.

title.children: Piastri bemoans 'a few wrong calls' after Verstappen's stunning move

image.altText: A woman looks out of a window

props.synopsis: Mother of seven, Jeannie Erceg, has been moved out of public housing twice to make way for the Victorian government's housing renewal agenda. She's feeling hesitant about an impending third move.

title.children: Forced to move three times, Jeannie is the face of social housing upheaval

image.altText: Mark Nawaqanitawase  looks to his right during a Roosters' NRL match.

props.synopsis: An NRL match in western Sydney on Friday night has given Australian rugby a timely reminder of a world-class talent they once had playing their game.

title.children: Why NRL's 'try of the decade' will remind Wallabies of what they're missing

image.altText: Alexis Ohanian, Aggie Beever-Jones, Serena Williams, Wieke Kaptein and Ashley Lawrence with the FA Cup

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr was back in Australia but her Chelsea side had a VIP visitor in Serena Williams, who watched them seal an English trophy treble at Wembley.

title.children: No Sam Kerr, but Serena Williams watches Chelsea complete domestic treble

image.altText: Wout van Aert celebrates

props.synopsis: Wout van Aert banishes early-season disappointment with a thrilling victory on stage nine of the Giro d'Italia as several favourites lose time on Tuscany's gravel roads.

title.children: Chaos on Giro d'Italia gravel stage as favourites crash, lose time

image.altText: A white naval vessel stationary in river water under the Brooklyn Bridge in the dark, with its mast snapped at a 90-degree angle

props.synopsis: Two people have died and at least 17 others were injured after the Mexican Navy ship, the Cuauhtémoc, hit the Brooklyn Bridge in New York City during a promotional tour.

title.children: Two dead, multiple injured after Mexican ship crashes into Brooklyn Bridge

image.altText: Carlos Alcaraz holds the Italian Open trophy next to Jannik Sinner

props.synopsis: Carlos Alcaraz claims the Italian Open over returning world number one Jannik Sinner, ending the local's perfect return to the sport from a doping ban with a 7-6 (5), 6-1 victory in Rome.

title.children: Alcaraz crushes Sinner in Italian Open final

image.altText: Four seals resting close to each other on a rocky shore.

props.synopsis: Australia is surrounded by the deadly H5N1 strain of bird flu. And it is morphing as sea animals and birds bring it ever closer to these shores.

title.children: 'Unprecedented and alarming': Bird flu has morphed to wipe out seals

image.altText: couple in kayak on beach

props.synopsis: The weather bureau predicts scattered showers for the south-east on Monday and Tuesday, before sunny conditions take over for the rest of the week into next weekend.

title.children: Clearer skies ahead for Queensland as sunshine returns after wet autumn

image.altText: A black-and-white movie still of a male chef and a waitress looking at each other through a restaurant lobster tank.

props.synopsis: The plight of immigrant workers in a divided America forms the backbone of this visceral movie set in the chaos of a New York restaurant kitchen.

title.children: Rooney Mara stars in new kitchen drama film reminiscent of The Bear

image.altText: A group of MPs with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese in foreground.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese's re-elected government includes a record number of female MPs, but insiders worry there is a long road ahead to promote women to top leadership roles.

title.children: PM's captain's pick throws doubt on when Labor will get next female leader

image.altText: Debris is scattered outside a parched building

props.synopsis: One person is dead and at least five are injured after an explosion at a fertility clinic in Palm Springs, California.

title.children: California fertility clinic bombing an 'act of terrorism', FBI says

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks at Ali France's campaign headquarters

props.synopsis: Does Labor have a mandate to do what it wants after its big election win? Do mandates even exist?

title.children: Does Labor have a mandate to do what it wants after its big election win?

image.altText: A toddler sitting behind a birthday cake.

props.synopsis: Lin Fu Zhen was a name that I constantly rejected as I thought it sounded different from other Indonesian names. Recently, I realised the negative feelings might have stemmed from how the ethnic Chinese minority in Indonesia were treated in the past.

title.children: I denied my Chinese heritage until I found my happy place

image.altText: Woman in blue tights and red jacket stands in front of fashion week sign.

props.synopsis: The popularity of thrifted and second-hand items has been on display at this year's Fashion Week. Experts say it's vital for the future of the industry.

title.children: Thrifted clothing booming at this year's Australian Fashion Week
